solution_line_template: Three years from now, Kate will be {kate_now} years + {years_from_now} years = <<{kate_now}+{years_from_now}={kate_future}>>{kate_future} years old.
So by that time, Tully will be {kate_future} years x {tully_multiplier} = <<{kate_future}*{tully_multiplier}={tully_future}>>{tully_future} years old.
This means, Tully is {tully_future} years - {years_from_now} years = <<{tully_future}-{years_from_now}={tully_now}>>{tully_now} years old now.
Therefore, Tully was {tully_now} years - {years_ago} year = {tully_last_year} years old last year.
